name: comprehensive
content:
comprehensive adjective
(COMPLETE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 complete and including everything that is necessary: We offer you a comprehensive training in all aspects of the business. Is this list comprehensive or are there some names missing? He has written a fully comprehensive guide to Rome.
Comprehensive insurance gives financial protection against most risks, for example including damage to a driver's own vehicle as well as to other vehicles: It is a common misconception that car hire insurance is comprehensive. The trend is towards less comprehensive health insurance. See also
fully comprehensive
More examplesFewer examplesThe two governments have agreed to engage in a comprehensive dialogue to resolve the problem.If you are a young, inexperienced driver, it is worth having comprehensive insurance.The book gives a comprehensive account of the English Civil War.This is a comprehensive guide to the birds of the British Isles.We gave the house a comprehensive spring clean.
